SourceString: These hasty scrawlings are faded by time:\r\n\r\n\"...send reinforcements! Skylla,, she...\"

On the edge of this temple are two chained skeletons, likely remains of ancient priests who served in this place. A dusty scroll lies beside one:\r\n\r\n\"The Priests of Kronos remain below, entombed within. Let them rot with their beloved scrolls, never again seeing the light of the sun. Such is the fate of any who seek forbidden lore. Those who dare tread these profaned halls be warned.\"

\"…Zeus banished his father’s body to Tartaros, and he and his siblings banded together, gathering powerful allies, to face the remaining Titans in the ten-year battle that boiled seas and cracked the earth…\"

\"…must remember that “Titan” is a title. The Titans are one group of gods, the older generation led by Kronos, and the Olympians are another, the younger generation led by Zeus, but the nature of their divinity remains the same…\"
\"...time ticks ever on, wearing us down with wrinkles and aches… but by invoking its master we can wash them away, refreshing youth, extending our threads longer and longer…\"
\"…in his mighty hand, a sickle of adamantine, dripping red with gore of his father’s gelded loins…\"

\"…they must have been squished inside his belly, pressed together. Unable to starve, but hungry, never having tasted mother’s milk. No wonder they are tyrants. They were driven mad before they ever saw the sun…\"

The ancient inscription is carved by many hands, representing the collected research of generations of Priests of Kronos. It gives specific, step-by-step instructions on how to find the King of Titans\' body where it lies broken in Tartaros. How to gather power from Titan Ichor and use it to infuse his veins with fresh divine blood. How to revive the Master of Time so that he might undo Zeus’ trickery and take back his rightful throne, surely conferring his favor on whomever aided his return...

Day 1:\r\nQueen Erana’s soldiers have sealed us in. The food is running out. If Alektruon is wrong, then we will all die down here. The Fates are cruel. I joined the order to search from an escape from death before age claimed me, but it only hastened my end. Reader, if you find this amongst my bones, know that my name was Klumenos and I was alive.
The mural depicts a group of women performing some sort of ritual around a dead tree. The only word you can make out, carved around the border is \"Kronos.\"
\"HE WILL RISE AGAIN! HE WILL RISE AND CARRY US BACKWARD TO YOUTH AND LIFE ETERNAL!\"
\"Why is our membership so low!? We offer the promise of eternal life! Tell the recruiters to start with that. The Queen\'s ire is irrelevant...\"

\"Why do we mortals worship the gods? Because they are just? No. Because they are powerful. Kronos eclipses Zeus\'s power a hundredfold, so he is a hundred times more worthy of worship. Zeus bested him with trickery!\"
Day 9:\r\nHe has attempted the ritual. It did not work. The food is gone. We thought ourselves able to master Time, but it will end us.

Day 15:\r\nIt worked. After a fashion. Alektruon was able to refresh his youth. His hair turned from white to fresh black. His belly filled out and he was a well-fed youth again. He says it will be temporary, but that we can perform the ritual again and again, staving off age and starvation…

Day 30:\r\nWe are not immortal. Two of the others got in a fight. They stabbed each other. They bled out on the floor, and the ritual did not revive them. Alektruon claims that true immortality is possible, but I do not know. We have time to keep trying. We must ensure that we do not fight. There are a score of us left, and with us all researching as one we can surely find the answer. We must not fight.
Day 937:\r\nWe found the answer! At last! Praise Kronos! He can give us true immortality! He can restore those who have died! We must simply revive him from where he lies in Tartaros!

Day 10946:\r\nI used to feel Kronos in my heart but now I see him in my dreams and his eyes are so dark with bright fire in the middle his smile is crooked and I fear that he will not aid us when we raise him and the ones who die will kill again and the world will be turned upside down

…Zeus returned to Mount Othrys, for the first time since his birth, disguised by Rhea as Kronos’s cupbearer. Zeus filled Kronos’s bronze goblet with divine poison, and when Kronos took a sip, he was struck dead before he could use his mastery of time to erase his final mistake. Zeus’ siblings spilled forth from their father’s gullet, whole and grown. Zeus banished his father’s body to Tartaros, and he and his siblings banded together, gathering powerful allies, to face the remaining Titans in the ten-year battle that boiled seas and cracked the earth…
“The blood of sacrifices will flow for the King of Titans’ favor! Rejoice! Beast, man and god will all bleed in his honor!”
These ancient bones wear a talisman with a sickle symbol and fine bronze armor, flecked with the rusted remains of old blood.
This well-worn Mycenaean armament has “ERANA” inscribed into the bronze of the shield boss.
The dusty skull has one word etched into it: \"RESTORE\"
\"...I beg you, if you delay snipping her thread, just by a few seasons more, then I will offer all the wealth I have in supplication...\"
\"...blood of the sky himself... power to raise the son... veins filled with divinity...\"
\"...and as the last Titan fell, Lachesis went to Zeus and told him of his duty and his burden, to stand atop the tapestry the Fates had woven, its guardian and protector...\"
Ichthian corpses boil in foul water, the last strips of flesh dissolving away.
\"...The power itself moves the bones, unmarred by pity or doubt. The soul is not returned to walk, restless and tortured, as the Mycenaeans do after the Shattering of Night...\"
\"...it is vital you leave as little flesh upon the bones as possible. Flesh remembers the old will, but bone is pure and yields to new masters...\"
Flesh has been scraped from bone with a sharp stone, then tiny symbols have been engraved.

"...Not a great pirate, 
nor much of a poet. 
But I could handle a bow.
My boat's where I <st>stashed</> stowed it!"
This climbing gear looks expensive... and abandoned.
Gear that seems to have been left behind during hasty climbing.
A dead horse, its bones shattered as if it fell from a great height.

A rough map depicts Pyrgos and its surrounding area. The ichthian writing is difficult to read, but you can make out \"flood dam,\" \"send warriors south,\" \"kill humans,\" \"find Titan Ichor for her,\" and \"new ichthian empire.\"
The mummified remains of an unlucky adventurer. Gold is clutched tightly in skeletal hands.
\"...dangerous prisoners who have spread lies against Her Majesty. I want all cells triple-checked. There will be no more mistakes...\"
